translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with Timira
The Elder Nipannañjali’s Story

analyzed: rukkha mūle nisinnā uha  paramena ca
translated: “I was sitting at the root of a tree,🔽with a great illness,
and I was overcome with great compassion,
in the forest, in the jungle.
Out of compassion,
the Teacher Tissa came to me;
I was lying down,
and I put my hands together in respect.
With a confident mind, joyful,
to the most excellent of all beings;
I worshipped the Buddha,
and then I died.
For twenty-two eons,
I worshipped the most excellent of men;
I do not recall any bad destination,🔽this is the fruit of my worship.
For the fifth eon from now,
there will be five great flames;
Endowed with the seven treasures,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā nipannañjaliko thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā nipannañjalikaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder monk Nipannañjali recited these verses.
The Elder Nipannañjali’s Story, the third.
